channel.title: Mapping on Yet Another Geographer
channel.description: Recent content in Mapping on Yet Another Geographer

item.title: New York is very nice
item.description: And working on getting spatial statistics in the hands of average users with CartoDB is much nicer. imported from: yetanothergeographer

item.title: First CartoDB map
item.description: First time using CartoDB. Pretty cool that you can just embed the map anywhere and it renders in an iframe. This is a map of the Polsby-Popper metric for US Congressional districts. In essence, people use it to identify how “normal” a political district’s shape is, with larger values being more “regular.” It’s the same as used in a washington post piece. My methodology differs a bit from their published map, and I’d love to figure out how to get the neat little hover info on the WaPo map.
